meanings.definition: A small window or opening in a building.
meanings.sent1: The cat sat by the winnock, watching the birds outside.
meanings.sent2: She opened the winnock to let in some fresh air.
meanings.sent3: The winnock seemed to whisper secrets to those who passed by.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes were like winnocks, revealing her thoughts to all.
meanings.sent5: The winnock framed a picturesque view of the garden.

meanings.definition: To peep or look out from a window or opening.
meanings.sent1: He would winnock out to see if the mail had arrived.
meanings.sent2: She winnocked cautiously to check if anyone was approaching.
meanings.sent3: The curious squirrel winnocked from the tree hollow.
meanings.sent4: His eyes winnocked from behind the curtain, observing the street.
meanings.sent5: The child winnocked out of the tent, eager to explore.
